result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All conditions of probation in Count 6 are inclusive of Count 2.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders sentence credit of 108 days.
Concurrent with: Count 6

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions  of Count 6 are inclusive of Count 2.

supervisions.notes: Costs of Count 4 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Count 6.

Time served.  With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: All costs of Count 4 shall be paid as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall not enter any establishment where the primary purpose is sale or consumption of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations, including but not limited to mental health counseling and taking all mental health prescriptions as prescribed by a professional.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders sentence credit of 139 days.  Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving one year of confinement.

Per Court 7-14-16 additional sentence credit granted for a total of 143 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall have contact with Jennifer M. only as permitted by the Department of Corrections.

Court orders judgment for unpaid financial obligations.

All conditions of Extended Supervision are inclusive of conditions of probation as contained in the Corrected Judgment of Conviction dated December 8, 2015.

miscConds.notes: All conditions of probation in Count 6 are inclusive of Count 7.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders sentence credit of 108 days.
Concurrent with: Count 6 and Count 2.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of Count 6 are incusive of Count 7.

Sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 10:30 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant's wife also appears.  State agrees with the NGI report.  Atty. Jaeger advises the defendant request to withdraw the NGI plea.  Court holds colloquy with the defendant and defendant concurs to withdraw the NGI plea.  Court allows withdrawal of the plea.  State indicates both sides free to argue at sentencing.  Defendant admits Repeater status.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2, Count 4, Count 6 and Count 7.   Recess.  Reconvene.  Atty. Jaeger advises on the basis for counts entered guilty pleas on.  Court dismissed Count 1, Count 3 and Count 5 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 2, Count 4, Count 6 and Count 7.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Atty. Jaeger moves for bail modification to lower cash bond to $5,000.00, State does not oppose slightly lower cash bond but higher than $5,000.00.  Court denies bail modification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15ME133)(12CF236)  State is not contesting the competency finding and defense does not contest the report and agrees is competent.  WITNESS:  Andrew P. M.  Atty. Jaeger and defendant waive right to evidentiary hearing on competency.  Court accepts the findings and does determine that the defendant is competent to proceed.  State indicates defendant will enter plea to Count 1, Count 2, Count 4 and Count 6 and Count 3, Count 5 and Count 7 would be dismissed for read-in.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.    Not guilty plea entered to all 7 counts and NGI.  Court orders Dr. Pankiewicz to do NGI examination and prepare report.  Judge left bench briefly.  Atty. Jaeger makes statements on doctor being appointed and have no objection to court's appointment.  Atty. Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Victim also appears.  Defendant waives reading of the information.  Counsel advises there is an agreement as to which counts the defendant will enter a plea to and also enter NGI pleas and obtain a report, State would move to dismiss for read-in Count 3, Count 5, Count 7.  State indicates both sides free to argue if special plea supported and if special plea not supported would not be contesting the finding and requesting a predispositional report from DHS for conditional release determination.  Defendant makes statements and appears unclear and uncertain.  Court has concern on the defendant's competency.  Atty. Jaeger request a competency evaluation.  Court orders a competency evaluation.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
